msIdentifier.msName: RB MSS M108a, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

encodingDesc.p: The file data/letters/1880-9/1883/83-08-04-final.doc was converted from Microsoft Word format into TEI using an XProc pipeline.

div.p: RB MSS M108a, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

Algae from Prof. Wilson arrived at Lund 9 Jul. 1883.
See M to J. Agardh, 17 May 1883. See also J. Agardh to M, 4 Augustt 1883 (in this edition as 83-08.04a).
(of those marked * more specimens are desired)

4. Dilophus tener
In AlgaeBase (accessed 29 July 2018) as Dilophus tenera, but published as D. tener in J. Agardh (1894-1903), Continuatio 1, p. 95. J. Ag. nov. sp.
new species. If a name designated as 'nov. sp' or equivalent on this list is in AlgaeBase, publication details are not given in notes to this list. AlgaeBase (http://www.algaebase.org/search/species/) will provide publication details, with in most cases links to to the original description, as well as details of synonyms and of type specimens, a select bibliography on the species, notes on habitat and, often, an image of the live organism, and sometimes a published illustration.

22. Laurencia delesserioides
Not in AlgaeBase (accessed 30 July 2018).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.25in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.25in;

div.p: 27. appears to be a [small] specimen of a plant (Chrysymenia Meredithiana) from Tasmania*
28 new to me, perhaps new Genus.*

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3126in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3126in;

div.p:
32. Merrifieldia ramentacea (new Genus) = Hypnea ramentacea J. Ag. Epicr.
J. Agardh (1848-1901), vol. 3, part 1, p. 562, issued in 1876 with part title ‘Epicris systematis Floridearum’.
34 Dilophus foliosus J. Ag. = No 107 in a former collect.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: 36 Delesseria revoluta major = 106 in a form. collect.
39. Bindera Splachnoides Harv. (? not convenient with fruit)

40
Caulerpa curvifolia nov. sp .
Not published by Agardh but listed in J. B. Wilson (1886), p.5; J. B. Wilson (1887), p.4; and J. B. Wilson (1889), p.6.
42. Wrangelia crassa? an potius Griffithsia sp.*

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
43. Wrangelia clavifera new sp.*
Not published by Agardh but listed in J. B. Wilson (1886), p.10.

44 Halyseris Achrostichoides
Haliseris achrostichoides in AlgaeBase, but described as Halyseris achrostichoides in J. Agardh (1873-90), part 2, p. 133. J. Ag.

49. Scinaia furcellata australis
This variety not in AlgaeBase (accessed 31 July 2018).

div.p: 63. Polysiphonia sp. forsan ad P. rufo-lanosam accedens.

div.p: 64. Perithalia inermis J. Ag. (= Fucus inermis Turn.) forma juvenilis

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: 66. Cystophora paniculata (specimen not to be determined)?
67 Stenocladia furcata with Ptilota siliculosa parasitical

74
Stenogramma leptophylla
nov. sp. (antheridiis) — with fr.*
78. Laurencia sp. (ad L. tasmanicam et L. thyrsiferam).

div.p: 86. Gigartina sp. ad Gig. grandifidam vel G. circumcinctam var. (= Gigart. radulae forma Harv).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: [towards Gig. grandifida or a variety of G. circumcincta (= a form of Gigart. radula Harv).]

div.p: 90. (mihi ignota; non est Chylocladia podagrica Harv.; sec. structuram ad Scinaiam accedit)*

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.5909in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: [unnknown to me; it is not Chylocladia podagrica Harv.; according to the structure it approaches Scinaia.]
95. Callithamnion mucronatum J. Ag. forma tenuis

div.p:
135 probably a new sp. of Callith.
Callithamnion .
near to C. plumigerum Harv; in a former collection it was No 89.
136. Ceramium sp. near to C. miniatum — but spec. too imperfect.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.4374in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4374in;

div.p: 141. Nizzophlaea Tasmanica perhaps the same as No 76 in a former collection, which was erroneously referred to Rhabd. robusta.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.4374in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4374in;

div.p: 150 Chondriopsis foliifera J Ag. = no 57 in a form. collect. which erroneously was referred to Rhabdonia new sp.

153. Wrangelia clavifera
Not published by Agardh but listed in J. B. Wilson (1886), p.10. See no. 43 above, where Agardh designates this as a new species, so it is not likely to be an error for W. clavigera. statu denudata.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: 156 Nitophyllum polyanthum majus (= no 67 in a form. collect.)

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
160 Spathoglossum australasicum
Spatoglossum? more spec. and if possible in fruit*

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.4374in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4374in;

div.p: 161. Helminthocladia australis? your specimen seems to be a sp. of Helminthora.

165 (168?) Codium Mülleri
In AlgaeBase as C. muelleri.
168. (165?) Ceramium sp. ad Cer. isogonum — too imperfect.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: 170 Delesseria revoluta with a sp. of Melobesia near to M. verrucata.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.4374in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4374in;

div.p: 177. = 109 and = 85 in a form. collection but erroneously referred to Wrangel. nobilis
178. Callithamnion sp. perhaps C. angustati forma?

180. Thamnocarpus glomuliferus J. Ag. = 95 in a form. collect.*
AlgaeBase has Thamnocarpus glomuliferer and indicates that Agardh spelled the species epithet as glomuliferus when published.

182.
Ptilonia subulata
J Ag. new sp.*
Not in AlgaeBase (accessed 30 July 2018). Possibly the species published as Ptilonia subulifera in J. Agardh (1873-90), part 6, p. 46.

185.
Myriodesma pinnatifidum
J. Ag. new sp.*
Not published by Agardh but listed in J. B. Wilson (1887); J. B. Wilson (1889), p.12; and J. B. Wilson (1892), p.159.
It is desirable that new species are to be had in several specimens, and if possible in fruit. I have marked these with a *.
